item.title: Get better at Hacka(Data)-thons
item.description: Over the past week I participated in Hong Leong Bank’s(HLB) annual Can You Hack It 2020 Datathon, and managed a top 10 finish after pitching to a (digital) panel of C-suite and M.D. level judges. The experience was certainly eye-opening and very hard-earned, with my nearly throwing in the towel at multiple points throughout the event. I’d like to share a little on the event itself, the problem and my motivation towards the solution, and the lessons I’d be bringing into my next hackathon, which I hope would be useful to you, dear reader.

item.title: Food Delivery Doesn't Work
item.description: From 2016-2019 I had the privilege of rolling with a start-up through its explosive growth, stagnation, and subsequent demise all in the period of 3 odd years. These are some of the hard-earned lessons gained through my time in the trenches, all of which point to my core thesis that the end-to-end food delivery business model is not viable. This post will be structured as follows: Breaking down the lay of the land in 2015 The (apparent) strengths of the business model Why it doesn’t work, and the lessons thereof In the beginning (circa 2015) By now, startup purgatory is filled with the corpses of well-funded attempts such as Munchery, Sprig, Maple, Spoonrocket and our own.
